info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:35PM EDT until August 29 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SANILAC AND ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 635 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Port Sanilac to near Lakeport to near Marysville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Sanilac and St. Clair Counties, including the following locations... Anchorville, North Street, Amador, Brockway, Fort Gratiot, Avoca, Fargo, Berville, Roseburg and Ruby. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
